etymology.description: 竹(竹) (zhú, "bamboo") + 其(其) (qí, "his") = combines bamboo element with phonetic component 其 to convey 'basket' -> specialization of 其
etymology.interpretation: The character 箕(箕) (jī, "basket") was created to specify the meaning of 'basket' by adding the bamboo radical 竹(竹) (zhú, "bamboo") to the character 其(其) (qí, "his"), which provides the phonetic cue. This reflects its use as a container often made from bamboo.

examples.chinese: 老农用箕收割稻谷(老農用箕收割稻穀)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎo nóng yòng jī shōugē dào gǔ。
examples.english: The old farmer uses a basket to harvest rice.

examples.chinese: 在村口(在村口)，小贩将粮食倒进箕中(小販將糧食倒進箕中)。
examples.pinyin: Zài cūnkǒu, xiǎofàn jiāng liángshí dào jìn jī zhōng。
examples.english: At the village entrance, the vendor pours grain into the basket.
